article_title: Does Limiting Conflicts On FDA Advisory Committees Harm Consumers?

article_metadata.author: Capital Flows

og.description: BY JAMES C. COOPER AND JOSEPH GOLEC - Financial links between healthcare professionals and the pharmaceutical industry have long been a public policy concern. But a pair of recent studies find no evidence that reportable financial conflicts lead committee members to make unwarranted approval recommendations.
